definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: What interests me are those who living and dying for me.
sentences.chinese: 令我感到兴趣的是那些为我要死要活的人。

sentences.english: Front she were placed in pot inside and half alive half dead, and now it becomes like a lady.
sentences.chinese: 前面被烫的要死要活的，现在倒是像一个偏偏淑女了。

sentences.english: People live, kill and die for love.
sentences.chinese: 人们会为爱情要死要活。

sentences.english: They had a tense relationship when they divorced, but now they have a good relationship.
sentences.chinese: 他们离婚的时候要死要活的，现在倒是很好的。

sentences.english: The fictional young lovers at the street curbs were still fighting as if it were life and death for trivial things.
sentences.chinese: 路边亲亲我我恋爱的小青年们为了一点小事要死要活。

definition: to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life

pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: to pester someone again and again
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: to be so in pain as to not want to live/to be so grieved as to wish one were dead
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
